aspect: 1. Jordan Henderson extends his contract with Liverpool,
2. Henderson is set to sign a new long-term deal worth £100,000 a week,
3. Henderson, Daniel Sturridge, and Philippe Coutinho agree contract extensions in Brendan Rodgers' squad.
explain: Jordan Henderson has signed a new deal with Liverpool, extending his contract until the summer of 2020 and securing him a weekly salary of around £100,000. Despite being set to join Manchester City in a transfer worth £10 million this summer, Henderson wants to stay at Liverpool and has been one of the team's most improved players under Brendan Rodgers' coaching. He has contributed 13 assists throughout the season.

Jordan Henderson is set to sign a new long-term deal worth £100,000 a week, keeping him at Liverpool until the summer of 2020. This comes as the midfielder is highly valued by the club and has shown significant improvement under Brendan Rodgers, helping him become one of Liverpool's key contributors with 13 assists this season.

Henderson, Daniel Sturridge, and Philippe Coutinho are extending their contracts under Brendan Rodgers' leadership, reflecting the positive impact he has had on their performances and improvement on the team's overall standings.
